recipe.recipe_name: Spinach and Mushroom Egg White Omelette
recipe.ingredients: - egg whites: 6 large - fresh spinach: 2 cups - mushrooms (sliced): 1 cup - onions (chopped): 1/2 cup - garlic (minced): 1 clove - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - salt (optional): pinch - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon - low-fat feta cheese (optional): 1/4 cup
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Vegetables: Heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and minced garlic, and saut√© until onions are translucent. 2. Add Vegetables: Add mushrooms and spinach to the skillet. Cook until the mushrooms are soft and the spinach has wilted. 3. Make Omelette: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the egg whites, a pinch of salt (optional), and black pepper. Pour the mixture into the skillet over the cooked vegetables. Cook on medium heat until the edges start to lift from the pan. Sprinkle feta cheese over the omelette before folding. 4. Fold and Serve: Gently fold half of the omelette over to cover the filling. Cook for another minute or two, then slide onto a plate and serve hot.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 15g, Dietary Fiber: 4g, Sodium: 200mg, Saturated Fat: 2g, Total Fat: 10g, Protein: 20g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 6g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 345 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Egg Whites: 102 calories for 6 large Spinach: 14 calories for 2 cups Mushrooms: 15 calories for 1 cup Onions: 32 calories for 1/2 cup Garlic: 4 calories per clove Olive Oil: 119 calories for 1 tablespoon Feta Cheese: 59 calories for 1/4 cup - Serving People: 2
